verbs.description: Trump [V: is] using his executive power to allow families to be held together at the U.S. border during the prosecution process of illegal border crossings
[ARG0: Trump] is [V: using] [ARG1: his executive power] [ARG2: to allow families to be held together at the U.S. border during the prosecution process of illegal border crossings]
[ARG0: Trump] is using his executive power to [V: allow] [ARG1: families to be held together at the U.S. border during the prosecution process of illegal border crossings]
Trump is using his executive power to allow families to [V: be] held together at the U.S. border during the prosecution process of illegal border crossings
Trump is using his executive power to allow [ARG1: families] to be [V: held] [ARG2: together] [ARGM-LOC: at the U.S. border] [ARGM-TMP: during the prosecution process of illegal border crossings]
